column4: McDonald's October same-store sales fall 0.5 percent
column5: Nov 10 McDonald's Corp said on Monday sales at established restaurants fell across all regions in October  hurt by stiff competition in the United States  economic and political upheaval in Europe and the fallout from a supplier scandal in China.

column4: China criminal gang floods market with 100 metric tons of toxic tofu
column5: SHANGHAI A criminal gang in eastern China has sold almost 100 metric tons (110.23 tons) of toxic tofu onto the local market  the latest in a string of scares that have thrown light on shady practices in the country's food industry.

column4: Merck expects no writedowns for Zetia  Vytorin cholesterol drugs
column5: Merck & Co on Monday said long-awaited data from an 18 000-patient trial suggest the company will not have to write down the value of its blockbuster Zetia and Vytorin cholesterol drugs.

column4: Merck expects no writedowns for Zetia  Vytorin cholesterol drugs
column5: Nov 10 Merck & Co on Monday said long-awaited data from an 18 000-patient trial suggest the company will not have to write down the value of its blockbuster Zetia and Vytorin cholesterol drugs.

column4: MOVES-Former Bank of America healthcare banker joins Credit Suisse
column5: Nov 10 A former Bank of America banker who advises clients in the healthcare sector has joined Credit Suisse  according to an internal memo.

column4: Merck four-week hep C regimen with Gilead's Sovaldi comes up short
column5: An attempt by Merck & Co to shorten hepatitis C treatment to just four weeks by adding Gilead Sciences Inc's huge selling Sovaldi to its own oral two-drug combination came nowhere near the desired efficacy due to a high rate of relapses  according to interim data from a midstage study.

column5: * Europe's refiners face stiff competition from Asia  U.S.

column4: NCR adds hedge fund Marcato Capital's McGuire to board
column5: BOSTON NCR Corp  which makes automated teller machines  said on Monday that hedge fund manager Richard McGuire  NCR's biggest shareholder  will join its board less than a month after the company lowered its earnings forecast for the year.

column4: Fitch: Philippine Telcos' Margins to Narrow  Capex to Rise
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) SINGAPORE/SYDNEY  November 10 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings says in a special report  released today that profitability at Philippine Long Distance Telephone Company  (PLDT; BBB/Stable) and Globe Telecom  Inc. (Globe; BBB-/Stable) is likely to  decline and their capex increase in 2015  but their ratings will not be affected  given the available headroom. column4: Southwest Airlines expects current quarter unit revenue to grow 1 to 2 percent
column5: Southwest Airlines forecast modest growth in unit revenue for the current quarter during its investor day presentation on Monday.

column4: Taiwan's TSMC says October sales up 56 pct on year
column5: TAIPEI  Nov 10 TSMC  the world's biggest contract chip maker  posted a 55.9 percent rise in October sales from a year earlier. column4: Spain's Telefonica sells 2.5 pct of China Unicom
column5: MADRID  Nov 10 Spanish telecoms giant Telefonica SA said on Monday it had sold a 2.5 percent stake in China Unicom (Hong Kong) Ltd in a block trade for about 687 million euros ($854 million).

column4: Telefonica seeks up to $875 mln by selling China Unicom stake -term sheet
column5: HONG KONG  Nov 10 Spanish telecoms giant Telefonica SA is seeking to raise $859 million to $875 million by selling a stake in China Unicom (Hong Kong) Ltd   according to a term sheet seen by Reuters on Monday.

column4: Toll Brothers sells more homes at higher prices
column5: Toll Brothers Inc   the largest U.S. luxury homebuilder  reported a 29 percent jump in quarterly revenue after it sold more homes at higher prices as housing demand strengthened.

column4: UPDATE 1-Toll Brothers sells more homes at higher prices
column5: Nov 10 Toll Brothers Inc  the largest U.S. luxury homebuilder  reported a 29 percent jump in quarterly revenue after it sold more homes at higher prices as housing demand strengthened.

column4: Transocean says likely to retire additional rigs
column5: Nov 10 Transocean Ltd  the owner of the world's largest offshore drilling fleet  said it was likely to retire additional rigs as the company continued to face pressure due to slowdown in an oversupplied rig market.

column4: UPDATE 1-Mongolia PM ousting may delay mine talks -Turquoise Hill
column5: Nov 10 Last week's ousting of Mongolia's prime minister is likely to delay talks on resolving a long-running dispute over the huge Oyu Tolgoi copper and gold mine in the mineral-rich country  joint-mine owner Turquoise Hill Resources Ltd said on Monday.

column4: REFILE-Turquoise Hill loss narrows as sales start at Oyu Tolgoi mine
column5: Nov 10 Canada's Turquoise Hill Resources Ltd  reported a lower third-quarter loss due to the start of sales from its Oyu Tolgoi copper-gold mine in Mongolia and lower operating expenses.

column4: BRIEF-Taiwan's UMC Oct sales up 28.9 pct
column5: * Says Oct sales at T$13.5 billion (442.19 million US dollar)

column4: Florida 'race war' planner sentenced to six months
column5: ORLANDO Fla. A Florida man accused of training members of a white supremacist group for a "race war" at a heavily fortified compound near Orlando and Walt Disney World was sentenced on Monday to six months in jail  according to court records.

column4: ON THE MOVE-Wells Fargo lands JP Morgan broker team managing nearly $1 bln
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 10 Wells Fargo Advisors  Wells Fargo & Co's brokerage unit  landed a three-person team from JP Morgan Private Bank where they managed $972 million in client assets and deposits.

column4: Fitch Rates Whirlpool's Proposed $1B Euro-CP Program 'F2'
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  November 10 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned an 'F2' rating to  Whirlpool Europe B.V. as co-issuer of Whirlpool Corporation's (NYSE:  WHR)  proposed $1 billion Euro-Commercial Paper Program.  Whirlpool Corp. is co-issuer  and guarantor of the program. column4: Imperial Oil shuts Kearl oil sands mine for 'several weeks'
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Nov 10 Imperial Oil Ltd   Canada's No. 2 integrated oil company  said on Monday it has shut its 110 000 barrel per day Kearl oil sands mine in northern Alberta for several weeks after detecting what it called a "vibration issue" in the facility's ore-crushing unit.

column4: New Gold to buy Bayfield; Scorpio and US Silver & Gold to merge
column5: TORONTO  Nov 10 The precious metals sector in Canada  which has been battered by the plunge in gold and silver prices  received a small spot of positive news on Monday  with the announcement of two separate M&A deals.
